intro: Junellia thymifolia, commonly known as the thyme-leaved junellia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of thyme, giving it its common name. Junellia thymifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
